DataElement.preferredName: Linear Analogue Self-Assessment Past Week Average Severity of Pain Score 11 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated perception of the average severity of their pain during the past week, using an eleven point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Linear Analogue Self-Assessment Past Week Average Severity of Pain Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A self-reported questionnaire used to measure general well-being and the major domains of quality of life (mental, physical, emotional, social, and spiritual well-being) in patients receiving cancer therapy._The most recent week, including today._A question about an individual's average severity of pain._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.: The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.: Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.: The most severe pain an individual can conceive of experiencing.: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::11: The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.: A subjective score of 4 on a Likert scale.
